sub_topic: Show that every group of order 27 is isomorphic to either the cyclic group C27 or the non-abelian group of order 27.
message_1: Let G be a group of order 27. Show that if G has an element of order 27, then G is isomorphic to which group?
message_2:
If G has an element of order 27, then G is a cyclic group. This is because the order of an element in a group divides the order of the group. Since 27 is a prime power (3^3), having an element of order 27 means that this element generates the entire group.

The group G is then isomorphic to the cyclic group of order 27, which is denoted as Z_27 or C_27.
